intro: Siphanthera miqueliana, commonly known as the Miquel's siphanthera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Siphanthera miqueliana is often found in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests.
